content: I have played a Natural numbers game two weeks ago using the link https://adam.math.hhu.de/#/g/hhu-adam/NNG4. But now everything looks different and my progress got reset. And it looks like new interface is not working because I can't see on the screen sentences that I type. Is there a way to access the old version of website? It used to look like a dangling tree with 2 leaves and the shorter path was on the right side of the tree.
cc @Jon Eugster @Alexander Bentkamp

No sorry, we dont offer the old version any more. @Kevin Buzzard will soon add the missing material back in, but everything has been rearranged a bit. You can set the game rules to lax to be able to skip what you already know.
What do you mean by not seeing the sentences you type?

Working on it now! Here's my local copy:

NNG.png

Once I have inequality world (which I've written all the proofs for) we can update the server.

If you're on a mobile then not seeing what you typed might be a bug with monaco editor that we might have no power to improve on.

In any case, please write Alex or myself to describe the problem more detailed, so we can hopefully fix it.

Sorry about loosing your progress, but you can always skip levels by selecting "relaxed"
By the way, the first time I saw this "relaxed" word I was super confused. It sounds like it refer to proof rigor instead of level progession.
You want it to unlock the and_now_its_obvious tactic
Alexander Belov has marked this topic as resolved.
